This mount functions as a druids animal companion, using the hussars level as his effective druid level. The creature must be one that he is capable of riding and is suitable as a mount. A Medium-sized hussar can select a camel or a horse. A Small-sized hussar can select a pony or wolf, but can also select a boar or a dog if he is at least 4th level. At the GMs options, other animals may be suitable mounts for a hussar to select.
Dervish_Defender.Mounted Combat (Ex): At 1st level, a hussar gains Mounted Combat as a bonus feat, even if he does not meet the prerequisites.
Dervish_Defender.Mounted Maneuver Expertise (Ex): Starting at 1st level, a hussar and his trusty steed are so in tune with each other that they can work as one when performing maneuvers. Whenever a hussar is mounted and uses a maneuver with a movement component (such as making a charge attack, or taking an extra move action), the hussar can have his mount take the appropriate movement in his place. If the maneuver allows the hussar to make a charge attack, both him and his mount are considered to be charging.
Dervish_Defender.Formations (Ex): As the hussar levels, he learns a number of formations that assist both himself and his allies. Adopting a formation is a move action for the hussar, and allies within range of someone in the formation can enter the formation as a free action. Formations have a limited range, as noted in the formations description. In order for a hussars ally to participate in a formation and gain its benefits, they must start their turn within range of another ally who is participating in the formation. Allies participating in a formation do not necessarily have to be within range of the hussar; they merely must be within range of another ally within the formation. A hussar may only have one formation active at a time, and if the hussar leaves a formation, all allies in the formation also leave that formation. A creature can only gain the benefits of one formation at any given time. The hussar selects one formation from the following list to learn at 5th, 8th, 11th, 14th, and 17th levels:
Dervish_Defender.Aura (Ex): An ordained defender who worships a chaotic, evil, good, or lawful deity has a particularly powerful aura (as a cleric) corresponding to the deitys alignment (see thedetect evilspell for details).
Dervish_Defender.Divine Gift (Su): At 3rd level, an ordained defender receives supernatural empowerment from her deity in the form of a divine gift. She receives her choice of one inquisitor inquisition or warpriest blessing. She must be of the correct alignment to choose an alignment-based blessing. For determining the abilities gained from an inquisition, the ordained defenders effective inqusitor level is equal to her ordained defender level 2.
Dervish_Defender.Guardianship (Ex): At 1st level, the sworn protector may select a ward, a person whom she must protect no matter what the cost. When in combat and the sworn protectors ward is within 10ft of their wards position, the ward gains a +1 morale bonus to their AC and savings throws. This bonus increases by +1 at 5th level, and every four levels after that (9th, 13th, and 17th level). Additionally, the sworn protector may add her guardianship bonus to her attack and damage rolls as a morale bonus if the ward is within the sworn protectors guardianship range. This radius increases by 10ft at 6th and again at 12th level. A sworn protector may only have one ward at a time at 1st level; they may then select a second ward at 8th level and a 3rd ward at 15th level. To select a ward, the sworn protector must take ten minutes discussing tactics and practicing with his ward so that he may learn how best to protect him, and from there on he practices those tactics when he readies his maneuvers. A sworn protector may dismiss a creature as his ward at anytime as a free action.
Dervish_Defender.Defensive Intercept (Ex): With swift speed and trained instincts, a sworn protector is capable of sudden bursts of speed in the defense of a chosen ward. A number of times per day equal to 1 + the sworn protectors Intelligence bonus she may leap to her wards defense with lightning speed. As an immediate action, the sworn protector moves up to her base speed to a space within 10 ft. of a ward who is being subjected to an attack or effect that would cause harm, to thereby grant her guardianship benefits. This movement is subject to attacks of opportunity. If the sworn protector is too distant to reach her ward, she cannot use this ability.
Dervish_Defender.Shared Counter (Ex): At 3rd level, the warders ability to protect those around him expands to allow him to use readied counters with a range of personal to protect another as long as he is adjacent to their position. If the counter is unsuccessful, then the protected ally must rely on their own defenses. He may use this with no daily limit, but only as often as he has an immediate action to initiate a counter. Additionally, in the defense of a ward she may use her defensive intercept ability as part of the same immediate action to use a shared counter. This ability functions with the Extended Defense class feature.
Dervish_Defender.Zweihander Training: At 1st level, when wielding a two-handed weapon or a one-handed weapon in both hands, the warder gains a shield bonus to his armor class equal to his aegis class feature bonus.
Dervish_Defender.Zweihander Expertise (Ex): A zweihander sentinel loses access to the Broken Blade discipline and addsScarlet Throneto her list of available disciplines. She gains Sense Motive as a class skill. This ability does not cause zweihander sentinel archetype to be incompatible with other archetypes that alter the maneuvers class feature or her available disciplines, so long as she can still give up Broken Blade.
Dervish_Defender.Armament Shield (Ex): When wielding a one-handed weapon in two hands or a two-handed weapon, the weapon is treated as a light shield for the purposes of performing a shield bash attack on an opponent. The warder smashes with the butt of a spear-haft, the pommel of a greatsword, or the broadside of her axe. All are essentially the same and are treated as light shields for the purposes of shield bash attacks or martial maneuvers to be used with a weapon of this type (such as Iron Tortoise maneuvers that require a shield to function).
Dervish_Defender.Defensive Reach (Ex): At 6th level, the warder has supreme control over his environment and the use of his weapon to defend himself and his allies. When wielding a non-reach two-handed weapon, the warder increases his reach by five feet for use with attacks of opportunity and counters. When wielding a two-handed reach weapon the warder threatens adjacent enemies and may attack them as though he was not wielding a reach weapon.
Dervish_Defender.Punishing Defenses (Ex): At 12th level, the warder has gained a great deal of skill in using offense as his best defense. When making an attack of opportunity or when making an attack against a foe as part of a counter, he inflicts an additional 2d6 points of damage. This damage is not multiplied if the character scores a successful critical hit.

Excruciator.Converting Your Character: The hussar is a class template suitable for use with the warlord and warder classes. When converting a character to a hussar, the character loses or changes the following class features:
Excruciator.Maneuvers: A good-aligned ordained defender addsSilver Craneto her list of available disciplines, an evil-aligned ordained defender addsBlack Seraphto her list of available disciplines, and an ordained defender who is neither good nor evil addsEternal Guardianto her list of available disciplines. If the ordained defender does not have this disciplines associated skill as a class skill, she gains it as a class skill. Her initiation modifier is Wisdom, and any warder class features that previously used her Intelligence modifier now use her Wisdom modifier. She otherwise learns, readies, and initiates maneuvers as a standard warder.
Excruciator.Iaido (Ex): In addition to his normal maneuver recovery, a bushi can recover his maneuvers by sheathing his blade and taking a brief moment of quiet contemplation. When he sheathes a weapon (normally a move action), he recovers one maneuver. He cannot recover more than one maneuver per round this way, no matter how many weapons he sheathes or how many times he sheathes an individual weapon per round, nor can he use a maneuver in the same round it is recovered in this way. A bushi cannot use this ability to recover a maneuver in the same round in which it was initiated.
Excruciator.Iaido Training (Ex): At 1st level, a bushi gains Exotic Weapon Proficiency (katana) and Exotic Weapon Proficiency (wakizashi) as bonus feats, even if he does not meet their prerequisites.
Excruciator.Quick Draw (Ex): At 1st level, a bushi gains Quick Draw as a bonus feat, even if he does not meet the prerequisites. In addition, the bushi may sheathe his weapon without provoking attacks of opportunity.
Excruciator.Mixed Combat (Ex): At 6th level, a bushi gainsMixed Combatas a bonus feat, even if he does not meet the prerequisites. In addition, the bushi is considered to be threatening all adjacent squares even if his weapon is sheathed, and can draw his weapon when making any attack (including attacks of opportunity).
Excruciator.Bushido (Su): As a bushi grows in power, he gains access to abilities through the refinement of his spirit and his weapon by adhering to the principles of bushido.
Excruciator.Weapon and Armor Proficiencies: The zweihander sentinel loses proficiency with shields and tower shields.
Excruciator.Disciplines: The hawkguard gains access toSolar Wind, losing access to Primal Fury. Survival is no longer a class skill; Perception is now a class skill.
Excruciator.Bonus Feat: The dervish defender gains Two-Weapon Fighting as a bonus feat at 1st level.
Excruciator.Two-Weapon Defense (Ex): While not all dervish defenders fight in the same manner, most do and all are extensively trained in these fighting philosophies. While wearing light armor or no armor, wielding a weapon in each hand (or using a double weapon), and not using a shield heavier than a buckler, the warder may add her Intelligence bonus (if any) to her Armor Class. She retains this bonus even against touch attacks or when flat-footed, but loses this bonus should she be rendered helpless by any means.
Excruciator.Dervish Defense (Ex): A dervish defender is capable of an aggressive defense, attacking even as they defend. At 4th level, the dervish defender may use a counter against an enemys attack and if she successfully counters it, she may make an immediate attack of opportunity against that foe.
Excruciator.Shield of Blades (Ex): At 6th level, when fighting unarmed or with a weapon from the light blades, double weapon or close weapon weapon group in each hand, the dervish defender improves her shield bonus to AC by an amount equal to her aegis bonus. As an immediate action, the dervish defender may lose her shield bonus to armor class until the beginning of her next turn and grant an adjacent creature an equivalent shield bonus to armor class until the beginning of the dervish defenders next turn.
Excruciator.Grace of Blades (Ex): At 15th level the dervish defender gains mastery over her two-weapon style. Whenever the dervish defender makes an attack with one weapon while holding two or more weapons or using a double weapon (such as during a full attack during which she is not two-weapon fighting, or using a strike that includes a melee attack) she increases that attacks damage by an amount equal to one of her off-hand weapons damage (including any extraordinary and magical enhancements) plus one-half her Strength modifier. Whenever the dervish defender makes an attack with more than one weapon (such as when making a full attack while two-weapon fighting or a strike that includes an attack with two or more weapons) she increases the damage of her weapons (and their enhancements) by one die step (as if increasing in size).
Excruciator.Critical Evasion (Ex): This functions as the born of steel class feature, but only functions if the character is wearing light armor or no armor.
Excruciator.Lore of the Planes: The excruciator may trade one of her available disciplines for theElemental Fluxdiscipline. This ability does not cause excruciator archetype to be incompatible with other archetypes that alter the maneuvers class feature or her available disciplines. She otherwise learns, readies, initiates maneuvers as a standard member of her base class. In addition, the excruciator may select akashic feats as bonus feats in addition to combat feats.
Excruciator.Cosmic Agony (Su): At 5th level, the excruciator gains the ability to establish a planar link which intensifies as she takes damage. Whenever the excruciator takes damage equal to or greater than her initiator level, she gains one point of temporary essence which lasts for 1 minute. The excruciator can have a maximum number of temporary essence from this ability equal to half her excruciator level. Once per round, the excruciator may intentionally harm herself to compound this link as a swift action taking damage equal to her initiator level, to enter a stance or use a boost, and gaining 1 point of temporary essence. This essence, in addition to any other essence the excruciator possesses, can be invested in the following ways:
Excruciator.Mantle of Pain (Su): At 11th level, the excruciator learns to share the fruits of their suffering with those around them. Any creatures within the excruciators collective or affected by their aegis share the benefits of any essence invested in the Cosmic Agony class feature.
Excruciator.Master of Pain (Su): At 14th level, the excruciator has become so accustomed to suffering that injuries no longer trouble them. The excruciator becomes immune to pain effects and the bleeding condition. The excruciator gains one point of temporary point of essence when targeted by a pain effect or when they reduce a creature to 0 hit points (this counts as essence gained through cosmic agony for determining the max amount of temporary essence that the excruciator can have).
Excruciator.Fiends Grip (Su): The signature feature of fiendbound marauders is the ability to manifest an oversized, spiny spectral claw, often wrapped in barbed chains. To manifest her fiends grip, a warder must be wearing gauntlets or spiked gauntlets, which act as a focus for the weapon to come into the world. The warder can manifest up to one fiends grip for each gauntleted hand she has. Manifesting a fiends grip is a move action, and dismissing one is a free action.
Excruciator.The Dark Mark (Su): A fiendbound marauders armigers mark is tainted by his eldritch power, causing marked creatures to also become cursed for the duration of the mark. The mark is now a supernatural ability, but otherwise functions as the armigers mark class feature. The fiendbound marauder can use feats and abilities that require or alter the armigers mark class feature as normal.
Excruciator.Canny Pugilist (Ex): A fiendbound marauders monstrous fiends grip is as much a part of her body as it is her mind, allowing her to use it to great advantage. Starting at 4th level, the fiendbound marauder adds her fiendbound marauder initiation modifier as a competence bonus on combat maneuver checks made with her fiends grip.
Excruciator.Improved Fiends Grip (Su): Starting at 5th level, the fiendbound marauders fiends grip can strike incorporeal creatures as if it possessed theghost touchweapon special ability. In addition, the fiends grip can be manifested as a free action, rather than a move action. At 11th level, the fiendbound marauders fiends grips critical multiplier increases to x3.
Excruciator.Fiendish Empowerment (Su): At 8th level, the fiendbound marauders fiends grip infects his armor, causing it to grow cruel spikes and blades when her weapon manifests. While her fiends grip is manifested, the fiendbound marauders armor grows+1 ghost toucharmor spikesthat deal piercing and slashing damage. If the armor already had spikes, they grow crueler, dealing damage as if the fiendbound marauder was one size category larger, dealing piercing and slashing damage, and using the enhancement bonus granted by this ability or their original enhancement bonus, whichever is higher, and gaining the benefits of theghost touchweapon special ability. In addition, the fiendbound marauder gains resistance 10 to two of the following energy types: acid, cold, electricity, or fire. At 14th level, the enhancement bonus of these armor spikes increases to +2, and the fiendbound marauder gains resistance 10 to a third energy type from the above list. At 17th level, the enhancement bonus of these armor spikes increases to +3, and the energy resistances granted by this ability increase to 20.
Excruciator.Archer Training (Ex): With the exhaustive training that hawkguards undergo, the hawkguard becomes a skilled ranged combatant who specializes in the use of a branch of ranged weaponry. She may select one ranged weapon to be her favored. When wielding this weapon, she does not suffer a penalty to hit for wearing a buckler and retains her shield bonus to AC even when using that arm to attack with her chosen weapon. The hawkguard also gains Point Blank Shot as a bonus feat.
Excruciator.Ranged Defensive Focus (Ex): The hawkguard is a deadly opponent as he focuses on protecting his allies and himself while planning his next moves. This functions as the normal warder defensive focus, except for the following changes. When recovering warder maneuvers as a full-round action, the hawkguard threatens an area within 15 feet of herself, except for adjacent squares. This area increases by 5 feet for every five initiator levels the hawkguard possesses. The bowman threatens this space only if hes wielding a ranged weapon, and may make attacks of opportunity with ranged weapons as long as Ranged Defensive Focus is active.
Excruciator.Close Combat Archery (Ex): At 3rd level, the hawkguard no longer provokes attacks of opportunity when firing or reloading his favored weapon while threatened in melee combat. When using his ranged defensive focus ability, he may now attack foes in adjacent spaces to himself.
Excruciator.Defending the Sky (Ex): Upon reaching 5th level, the hawkguard becomes increasingly adept at protecting his allies from harm. Once per day he is capable of extending the use of his counters to react to multiple attacks. Any counter that the hawkguard possesses that has a duration of instant instead has a duration of 1 round. He may then use this counter against any attack targeting an allied creature that it could normally be used to repel. Every three levels beyond this (8th, 11th, 14th, and 17th levels) he may use this ability an additional time per day.
Excruciator.Evasive Reflexes (Ex): At 7th level the hawkguard gains evasion (as the rogue class feature, except it functions in medium and heavy armor in addition to light). As an immediate action, he may lose the benefits of the evasion ability for one round and grant it to an ally for one round.
Excruciator.Class Skills: Instead of the rigorous tactical training that most warders undergo, ordained defenders undergo a process of dogmatic indoctrination that lends them to more introspective pursuits, meditating on the nature of their faith and their role in their deitys plan. An ordained defender gains Knowledge (religion) as a class skill and loses Knowledge (nobility) as a class skill.

Once per round, the excruciator may intentionally harm herself to compound this link as a swift action taking damage equal to her initiator level, to enter a stance or use a boost, and gaining 1 point of temporary essence. This essence, in addition to any other essence the excruciator possesses, can be invested in the following ways:
Fiendbound_Marauder.Mantle of Pain (Su): At 11th level, the excruciator learns to share the fruits of their suffering with those around them. Any creatures within the excruciators collective or affected by their aegis share the benefits of any essence invested in the Cosmic Agony class feature.
Fiendbound_Marauder.Master of Pain (Su): At 14th level, the excruciator has become so accustomed to suffering that injuries no longer trouble them. The excruciator becomes immune to pain effects and the bleeding condition. The excruciator gains one point of temporary point of essence when targeted by a pain effect or when they reduce a creature to 0 hit points (this counts as essence gained through cosmic agony for determining the max amount of temporary essence that the excruciator can have).
Fiendbound_Marauder.Fiends Grip (Su): The signature feature of fiendbound marauders is the ability to manifest an oversized, spiny spectral claw, often wrapped in barbed chains. To manifest her fiends grip, a warder must be wearing gauntlets or spiked gauntlets, which act as a focus for the weapon to come into the world. The warder can manifest up to one fiends grip for each gauntleted hand she has. Manifesting a fiends grip is a move action, and dismissing one is a free action.
Fiendbound_Marauder.The Dark Mark (Su): A fiendbound marauders armigers mark is tainted by his eldritch power, causing marked creatures to also become cursed for the duration of the mark. The mark is now a supernatural ability, but otherwise functions as the armigers mark class feature. The fiendbound marauder can use feats and abilities that require or alter the armigers mark class feature as normal.
Fiendbound_Marauder.Canny Pugilist (Ex): A fiendbound marauders monstrous fiends grip is as much a part of her body as it is her mind, allowing her to use it to great advantage. Starting at 4th level, the fiendbound marauder adds her fiendbound marauder initiation modifier as a competence bonus on combat maneuver checks made with her fiends grip.
Fiendbound_Marauder.Improved Fiends Grip (Su): Starting at 5th level, the fiendbound marauders fiends grip can strike incorporeal creatures as if it possessed theghost touchweapon special ability. In addition, the fiends grip can be manifested as a free action, rather than a move action. At 11th level, the fiendbound marauders fiends grips critical multiplier increases to x3.
Fiendbound_Marauder.Fiendish Empowerment (Su): At 8th level, the fiendbound marauders fiends grip infects his armor, causing it to grow cruel spikes and blades when her weapon manifests. While her fiends grip is manifested, the fiendbound marauders armor grows+1 ghost toucharmor spikesthat deal piercing and slashing damage. If the armor already had spikes, they grow crueler, dealing damage as if the fiendbound marauder was one size category larger, dealing piercing and slashing damage, and using the enhancement bonus granted by this ability or their original enhancement bonus, whichever is higher, and gaining the benefits of theghost touchweapon special ability. In addition, the fiendbound marauder gains resistance 10 to two of the following energy types: acid, cold, electricity, or fire. At 14th level, the enhancement bonus of these armor spikes increases to +2, and the fiendbound marauder gains resistance 10 to a third energy type from the above list. At 17th level, the enhancement bonus of these armor spikes increases to +3, and the energy resistances granted by this ability increase to 20.
Fiendbound_Marauder.Archer Training (Ex): With the exhaustive training that hawkguards undergo, the hawkguard becomes a skilled ranged combatant who specializes in the use of a branch of ranged weaponry. She may select one ranged weapon to be her favored. When wielding this weapon, she does not suffer a penalty to hit for wearing a buckler and retains her shield bonus to AC even when using that arm to attack with her chosen weapon. The hawkguard also gains Point Blank Shot as a bonus feat.
Fiendbound_Marauder.Ranged Defensive Focus (Ex): The hawkguard is a deadly opponent as he focuses on protecting his allies and himself while planning his next moves. This functions as the normal warder defensive focus, except for the following changes. When recovering warder maneuvers as a full-round action, the hawkguard threatens an area within 15 feet of herself, except for adjacent squares. This area increases by 5 feet for every five initiator levels the hawkguard possesses. The bowman threatens this space only if hes wielding a ranged weapon, and may make attacks of opportunity with ranged weapons as long as Ranged Defensive Focus is active.
Fiendbound_Marauder.Close Combat Archery (Ex): At 3rd level, the hawkguard no longer provokes attacks of opportunity when firing or reloading his favored weapon while threatened in melee combat. When using his ranged defensive focus ability, he may now attack foes in adjacent spaces to himself.
Fiendbound_Marauder.Defending the Sky (Ex): Upon reaching 5th level, the hawkguard becomes increasingly adept at protecting his allies from harm. Once per day he is capable of extending the use of his counters to react to multiple attacks. Any counter that the hawkguard possesses that has a duration of instant instead has a duration of 1 round. He may then use this counter against any attack targeting an allied creature that it could normally be used to repel. Every three levels beyond this (8th, 11th, 14th, and 17th levels) he may use this ability an additional time per day.
Fiendbound_Marauder.Evasive Reflexes (Ex): At 7th level the hawkguard gains evasion (as the rogue class feature, except it functions in medium and heavy armor in addition to light). As an immediate action, he may lose the benefits of the evasion ability for one round and grant it to an ally for one round.
Fiendbound_Marauder.Class Skills: Instead of the rigorous tactical training that most warders undergo, ordained defenders undergo a process of dogmatic indoctrination that lends them to more introspective pursuits, meditating on the nature of their faith and their role in their deitys plan. An ordained defender gains Knowledge (religion) as a class skill and loses Knowledge (nobility) as a class skill.
Fiendbound_Marauder.Weapon and Armor Proficiency: Hussars are proficient with all simple and martial weapons, with light and medium armor, and with shields (except tower shields).
Fiendbound_Marauder.Maneuvers Readied: In addition to his base class normal maneuver recovery, a hussar recovers one expended maneuver every time he successfully negates an attack using the Mounted Combat feat.
Fiendbound_Marauder.Mount (Ex): At 1st level, a hussar gains the service of a loyal and trusty steed to carry him into battle. This mount functions as a druids animal companion, using the hussars level as his effective druid level. The creature must be one that he is capable of riding and is suitable as a mount. A Medium-sized hussar can select a camel or a horse. A Small-sized hussar can select a pony or wolf, but can also select a boar or a dog if he is at least 4th level. At the GMs options, other animals may be suitable mounts for a hussar to select.
Fiendbound_Marauder.Mounted Combat (Ex): At 1st level, a hussar gains Mounted Combat as a bonus feat, even if he does not meet the prerequisites.
Fiendbound_Marauder.Mounted Maneuver Expertise (Ex): Starting at 1st level, a hussar and his trusty steed are so in tune with each other that they can work as one when performing maneuvers. Whenever a hussar is mounted and uses a maneuver with a movement component (such as making a charge attack, or taking an extra move action), the hussar can have his mount take the appropriate movement in his place. If the maneuver allows the hussar to make a charge attack, both him and his mount are considered to be charging.
Fiendbound_Marauder.Formations (Ex): As the hussar levels, he learns a number of formations that assist both himself and his allies. Adopting a formation is a move action for the hussar, and allies within range of someone in the formation can enter the formation as a free action. Formations have a limited range, as noted in the formations description. In order for a hussars ally to participate in a formation and gain its benefits, they must start their turn within range of another ally who is participating in the formation. Allies participating in a formation do not necessarily have to be within range of the hussar; they merely must be within range of another ally within the formation. A hussar may only have one formation active at a time, and if the hussar leaves a formation, all allies in the formation also leave that formation. A creature can only gain the benefits of one formation at any given time. The hussar selects one formation from the following list to learn at 5th, 8th, 11th, 14th, and 17th levels:
Fiendbound_Marauder.Aura (Ex): An ordained defender who worships a chaotic, evil, good, or lawful deity has a particularly powerful aura (as a cleric) corresponding to the deitys alignment (see thedetect evilspell for details).
Fiendbound_Marauder.Divine Gift (Su): At 3rd level, an ordained defender receives supernatural empowerment from her deity in the form of a divine gift. She receives her choice of one inquisitor inquisition or warpriest blessing. She must be of the correct alignment to choose an alignment-based blessing. For determining the abilities gained from an inquisition, the ordained defenders effective inqusitor level is equal to her ordained defender level 2.
Fiendbound_Marauder.Guardianship (Ex): At 1st level, the sworn protector may select a ward, a person whom she must protect no matter what the cost. When in combat and the sworn protectors ward is within 10ft of their wards position, the ward gains a +1 morale bonus to their AC and savings throws. This bonus increases by +1 at 5th level, and every four levels after that (9th, 13th, and 17th level). Additionally, the sworn protector may add her guardianship bonus to her attack and damage rolls as a morale bonus if the ward is within the sworn protectors guardianship range. This radius increases by 10ft at 6th and again at 12th level. A sworn protector may only have one ward at a time at 1st level; they may then select a second ward at 8th level and a 3rd ward at 15th level. To select a ward, the sworn protector must take ten minutes discussing tactics and practicing with his ward so that he may learn how best to protect him, and from there on he practices those tactics when he readies his maneuvers. A sworn protector may dismiss a creature as his ward at anytime as a free action.
Fiendbound_Marauder.Defensive Intercept (Ex): With swift speed and trained instincts, a sworn protector is capable of sudden bursts of speed in the defense of a chosen ward. A number of times per day equal to 1 + the sworn protectors Intelligence bonus she may leap to her wards defense with lightning speed. As an immediate action, the sworn protector moves up to her base speed to a space within 10 ft. of a ward who is being subjected to an attack or effect that would cause harm, to thereby grant her guardianship benefits. This movement is subject to attacks of opportunity. If the sworn protector is too distant to reach her ward, she cannot use this ability.
Fiendbound_Marauder.Shared Counter (Ex): At 3rd level, the warders ability to protect those around him expands to allow him to use readied counters with a range of personal to protect another as long as he is adjacent to their position. If the counter is unsuccessful, then the protected ally must rely on their own defenses. He may use this with no daily limit, but only as often as he has an immediate action to initiate a counter. Additionally, in the defense of a ward she may use her defensive intercept ability as part of the same immediate action to use a shared counter. This ability functions with the Extended Defense class feature.
Fiendbound_Marauder.Zweihander Training: At 1st level, when wielding a two-handed weapon or a one-handed weapon in both hands, the warder gains a shield bonus to his armor class equal to his aegis class feature bonus.
Fiendbound_Marauder.Zweihander Expertise (Ex): A zweihander sentinel loses access to the Broken Blade discipline and addsScarlet Throneto her list of available disciplines. She gains Sense Motive as a class skill. This ability does not cause zweihander sentinel archetype to be incompatible with other archetypes that alter the maneuvers class feature or her available disciplines, so long as she can still give up Broken Blade.
Fiendbound_Marauder.Armament Shield (Ex): When wielding a one-handed weapon in two hands or a two-handed weapon, the weapon is treated as a light shield for the purposes of performing a shield bash attack on an opponent. The warder smashes with the butt of a spear-haft, the pommel of a greatsword, or the broadside of her axe. All are essentially the same and are treated as light shields for the purposes of shield bash attacks or martial maneuvers to be used with a weapon of this type (such as Iron Tortoise maneuvers that require a shield to function).
Fiendbound_Marauder.Defensive Reach (Ex): At 6th level, the warder has supreme control over his environment and the use of his weapon to defend himself and his allies. When wielding a non-reach two-handed weapon, the warder increases his reach by five feet for use with attacks of opportunity and counters. When wielding a two-handed reach weapon the warder threatens adjacent enemies and may attack them as though he was not wielding a reach weapon.
Fiendbound_Marauder.Punishing Defenses (Ex): At 12th level, the warder has gained a great deal of skill in using offense as his best defense. When making an attack of opportunity or when making an attack against a foe as part of a counter, he inflicts an additional 2d6 points of damage. This damage is not multiplied if the character scores a successful critical hit.

If the ordained defender does not have this disciplines associated skill as a class skill, she gains it as a class skill. Her initiation modifier is Wisdom, and any warder class features that previously used her Intelligence modifier now use her Wisdom modifier. She otherwise learns, readies, and initiates maneuvers as a standard warder.

A bushi cannot use this ability to recover a maneuver in the same round in which it was initiated.

Hawkguard.Bushido (Su): As a bushi grows in power, he gains access to abilities through the refinement of his spirit and his weapon by adhering to the principles of bushido.

While wearing light armor or no armor, wielding a weapon in each hand (or using a double weapon), and not using a shield heavier than a buckler, the warder may add her Intelligence bonus (if any) to her Armor Class. Hawkguard.Dervish Defense (Ex): A dervish defender is capable of an aggressive defense, attacking even as they defend. At 4th level, the dervish defender may use a counter against an enemys attack and if she successfully counters it, she may make an immediate attack of opportunity against that foe.
Hawkguard.Shield of Blades (Ex): At 6th level, when fighting unarmed or with a weapon from the light blades, double weapon or close weapon weapon group in each hand, the dervish defender improves her shield bonus to AC by an amount equal to her aegis bonus. As an immediate action, the dervish defender may lose her shield bonus to armor class until the beginning of her next turn and grant an adjacent creature an equivalent shield bonus to armor class until the beginning of the dervish defenders next turn.
Hawkguard.Grace of Blades (Ex): At 15th level the dervish defender gains mastery over her two-weapon style. Whenever the dervish defender makes an attack with more than one weapon (such as when making a full attack while two-weapon fighting or a strike that includes an attack with two or more weapons) she increases the damage of her weapons (and their enhancements) by one die step (as if increasing in size).

When wielding a non-reach two-handed weapon, the warder increases his reach by five feet for use with attacks of opportunity and counters. When wielding a two-handed reach weapon the warder threatens adjacent enemies and may attack them as though he was not wielding a reach weapon.
Hawkguard.Punishing Defenses (Ex): At 12th level, the warder has gained a great deal of skill in using offense as his best defense. When making an attack of opportunity or when making an attack against a foe as part of a counter, he inflicts an additional 2d6 points of damage. This damage is not multiplied if the character scores a successful critical hit.

Hussar.Converting Your Character: The hussar is a class template suitable for use with the warlord and warder classes. When converting a character to a hussar, the character loses or changes the following class features:
Hussar.Maneuvers: A good-aligned ordained defender addsSilver Craneto her list of available disciplines, an evil-aligned ordained defender addsBlack Seraphto her list of available disciplines, and an ordained defender who is neither good nor evil addsEternal Guardianto her list of available disciplines. If the ordained defender does not have this disciplines associated skill as a class skill, she gains it as a class skill. Her initiation modifier is Wisdom, and any warder class features that previously used her Intelligence modifier now use her Wisdom modifier. She otherwise learns, readies, and initiates maneuvers as a standard warder.
Hussar.Iaido (Ex): In addition to his normal maneuver recovery, a bushi can recover his maneuvers by sheathing his blade and taking a brief moment of quiet contemplation. When he sheathes a weapon (normally a move action), he recovers one maneuver. He cannot recover more than one maneuver per round this way, no matter how many weapons he sheathes or how many times he sheathes an individual weapon per round, nor can he use a maneuver in the same round it is recovered in this way. A bushi cannot use this ability to recover a maneuver in the same round in which it was initiated.
Hussar.Iaido Training (Ex): At 1st level, a bushi gains Exotic Weapon Proficiency (katana) and Exotic Weapon Proficiency (wakizashi) as bonus feats, even if he does not meet their prerequisites.
Hussar.Quick Draw (Ex): At 1st level, a bushi gains Quick Draw as a bonus feat, even if he does not meet the prerequisites. In addition, the bushi may sheathe his weapon without provoking attacks of opportunity.
Hussar.Mixed Combat (Ex): At 6th level, a bushi gainsMixed Combatas a bonus feat, even if he does not meet the prerequisites. In addition, the bushi is considered to be threatening all adjacent squares even if his weapon is sheathed, and can draw his weapon when making any attack (including attacks of opportunity).
Hussar.Bushido (Su): As a bushi grows in power, he gains access to abilities through the refinement of his spirit and his weapon by adhering to the principles of bushido.
Hussar.Weapon and Armor Proficiencies: The zweihander sentinel loses proficiency with shields and tower shields.
Hussar.Disciplines: The hawkguard gains access toSolar Wind, losing access to Primal Fury. Survival is no longer a class skill; Perception is now a class skill.
Hussar.Bonus Feat: The dervish defender gains Two-Weapon Fighting as a bonus feat at 1st level.
Hussar.Two-Weapon Defense (Ex): While not all dervish defenders fight in the same manner, most do and all are extensively trained in these fighting philosophies. While wearing light armor or no armor, wielding a weapon in each hand (or using a double weapon), and not using a shield heavier than a buckler, the warder may add her Intelligence bonus (if any) to her Armor Class. She retains this bonus even against touch attacks or when flat-footed, but loses this bonus should she be rendered helpless by any means.
Hussar.Dervish Defense (Ex): A dervish defender is capable of an aggressive defense, attacking even as they defend. At 4th level, the dervish defender may use a counter against an enemys attack and if she successfully counters it, she may make an immediate attack of opportunity against that foe.
Hussar.Shield of Blades (Ex): At 6th level, when fighting unarmed or with a weapon from the light blades, double weapon or close weapon weapon group in each hand, the dervish defender improves her shield bonus to AC by an amount equal to her aegis bonus. As an immediate action, the dervish defender may lose her shield bonus to armor class until the beginning of her next turn and grant an adjacent creature an equivalent shield bonus to armor class until the beginning of the dervish defenders next turn.
Hussar.Grace of Blades (Ex): At 15th level the dervish defender gains mastery over her two-weapon style. Whenever the dervish defender makes an attack with one weapon while holding two or more weapons or using a double weapon (such as during a full attack during which she is not two-weapon fighting, or using a strike that includes a melee attack) she increases that attacks damage by an amount equal to one of her off-hand weapons damage (including any extraordinary and magical enhancements) plus one-half her Strength modifier. Whenever the dervish defender makes an attack with more than one weapon (such as when making a full attack while two-weapon fighting or a strike that includes an attack with two or more weapons) she increases the damage of her weapons (and their enhancements) by one die step (as if increasing in size).
Hussar.Critical Evasion (Ex): This functions as the born of steel class feature, but only functions if the character is wearing light armor or no armor.
Hussar.Lore of the Planes: The excruciator may trade one of her available disciplines for theElemental Fluxdiscipline. This ability does not cause excruciator archetype to be incompatible with other archetypes that alter the maneuvers class feature or her available disciplines. She otherwise learns, readies, initiates maneuvers as a standard member of her base class. In addition, the excruciator may select akashic feats as bonus feats in addition to combat feats.
Hussar.Cosmic Agony (Su): At 5th level, the excruciator gains the ability to establish a planar link which intensifies as she takes damage. Whenever the excruciator takes damage equal to or greater than her initiator level, she gains one point of temporary essence which lasts for 1 minute. The excruciator can have a maximum number of temporary essence from this ability equal to half her excruciator level. Once per round, the excruciator may intentionally harm herself to compound this link as a swift action taking damage equal to her initiator level, to enter a stance or use a boost, and gaining 1 point of temporary essence. This essence, in addition to any other essence the excruciator possesses, can be invested in the following ways:
Hussar.Mantle of Pain (Su): At 11th level, the excruciator learns to share the fruits of their suffering with those around them. Any creatures within the excruciators collective or affected by their aegis share the benefits of any essence invested in the Cosmic Agony class feature.
Hussar.Master of Pain (Su): At 14th level, the excruciator has become so accustomed to suffering that injuries no longer trouble them. The excruciator becomes immune to pain effects and the bleeding condition. The excruciator gains one point of temporary point of essence when targeted by a pain effect or when they reduce a creature to 0 hit points (this counts as essence gained through cosmic agony for determining the max amount of temporary essence that the excruciator can have).
Hussar.Fiends Grip (Su): The signature feature of fiendbound marauders is the ability to manifest an oversized, spiny spectral claw, often wrapped in barbed chains. To manifest her fiends grip, a warder must be wearing gauntlets or spiked gauntlets, which act as a focus for the weapon to come into the world. The warder can manifest up to one fiends grip for each gauntleted hand she has. Manifesting a fiends grip is a move action, and dismissing one is a free action.
Hussar.The Dark Mark (Su): A fiendbound marauders armigers mark is tainted by his eldritch power, causing marked creatures to also become cursed for the duration of the mark. The mark is now a supernatural ability, but otherwise functions as the armigers mark class feature. The fiendbound marauder can use feats and abilities that require or alter the armigers mark class feature as normal.
Hussar.Canny Pugilist (Ex): A fiendbound marauders monstrous fiends grip is as much a part of her body as it is her mind, allowing her to use it to great advantage. Starting at 4th level, the fiendbound marauder adds her fiendbound marauder initiation modifier as a competence bonus on combat maneuver checks made with her fiends grip.
Hussar.Improved Fiends Grip (Su): Starting at 5th level, the fiendbound marauders fiends grip can strike incorporeal creatures as if it possessed theghost touchweapon special ability. In addition, the fiends grip can be manifested as a free action, rather than a move action. At 11th level, the fiendbound marauders fiends grips critical multiplier increases to x3.
Hussar.Fiendish Empowerment (Su): At 8th level, the fiendbound marauders fiends grip infects his armor, causing it to grow cruel spikes and blades when her weapon manifests. While her fiends grip is manifested, the fiendbound marauders armor grows+1 ghost toucharmor spikesthat deal piercing and slashing damage. If the armor already had spikes, they grow crueler, dealing damage as if the fiendbound marauder was one size category larger, dealing piercing and slashing damage, and using the enhancement bonus granted by this ability or their original enhancement bonus, whichever is higher, and gaining the benefits of theghost touchweapon special ability. In addition, the fiendbound marauder gains resistance 10 to two of the following energy types: acid, cold, electricity, or fire. At 14th level, the enhancement bonus of these armor spikes increases to +2, and the fiendbound marauder gains resistance 10 to a third energy type from the above list. At 17th level, the enhancement bonus of these armor spikes increases to +3, and the energy resistances granted by this ability increase to 20.
Hussar.Archer Training (Ex): With the exhaustive training that hawkguards undergo, the hawkguard becomes a skilled ranged combatant who specializes in the use of a branch of ranged weaponry. She may select one ranged weapon to be her favored. When wielding this weapon, she does not suffer a penalty to hit for wearing a buckler and retains her shield bonus to AC even when using that arm to attack with her chosen weapon. The hawkguard also gains Point Blank Shot as a bonus feat.
Hussar.Ranged Defensive Focus (Ex): The hawkguard is a deadly opponent as he focuses on protecting his allies and himself while planning his next moves. This functions as the normal warder defensive focus, except for the following changes. When recovering warder maneuvers as a full-round action, the hawkguard threatens an area within 15 feet of herself, except for adjacent squares. This area increases by 5 feet for every five initiator levels the hawkguard possesses. The bowman threatens this space only if hes wielding a ranged weapon, and may make attacks of opportunity with ranged weapons as long as Ranged Defensive Focus is active.
Hussar.Close Combat Archery (Ex): At 3rd level, the hawkguard no longer provokes attacks of opportunity when firing or reloading his favored weapon while threatened in melee combat. When using his ranged defensive focus ability, he may now attack foes in adjacent spaces to himself.
Hussar.Defending the Sky (Ex): Upon reaching 5th level, the hawkguard becomes increasingly adept at protecting his allies from harm. Once per day he is capable of extending the use of his counters to react to multiple attacks. Any counter that the hawkguard possesses that has a duration of instant instead has a duration of 1 round. He may then use this counter against any attack targeting an allied creature that it could normally be used to repel. Every three levels beyond this (8th, 11th, 14th, and 17th levels) he may use this ability an additional time per day.
Hussar.Evasive Reflexes (Ex): At 7th level the hawkguard gains evasion (as the rogue class feature, except it functions in medium and heavy armor in addition to light). As an immediate action, he may lose the benefits of the evasion ability for one round and grant it to an ally for one round.
Hussar.Class Skills: Instead of the rigorous tactical training that most warders undergo, ordained defenders undergo a process of dogmatic indoctrination that lends them to more introspective pursuits, meditating on the nature of their faith and their role in their deitys plan. An ordained defender gains Knowledge (religion) as a class skill and loses Knowledge (nobility) as a class skill.
Hussar.Weapon and Armor Proficiency: Hussars are proficient with all simple and martial weapons, with light and medium armor, and with shields (except tower shields).
Hussar.Maneuvers Readied: In addition to his base class normal maneuver recovery, a hussar recovers one expended maneuver every time he successfully negates an attack using the Mounted Combat feat.
Hussar.Mount (Ex): At 1st level, a hussar gains the service of a loyal and trusty steed to carry him into battle. This mount functions as a druids animal companion, using the hussars level as his effective druid level. The creature must be one that he is capable of riding and is suitable as a mount. A Medium-sized hussar can select a camel or a horse. A Small-sized hussar can select a pony or wolf, but can also select a boar or a dog if he is at least 4th level. At the GMs options, other animals may be suitable mounts for a hussar to select.
Hussar.Mounted Combat (Ex): At 1st level, a hussar gains Mounted Combat as a bonus feat, even if he does not meet the prerequisites.
Hussar.Mounted Maneuver Expertise (Ex): Starting at 1st level, a hussar and his trusty steed are so in tune with each other that they can work as one when performing maneuvers. Whenever a hussar is mounted and uses a maneuver with a movement component (such as making a charge attack, or taking an extra move action), the hussar can have his mount take the appropriate movement in his place. If the maneuver allows the hussar to make a charge attack, both him and his mount are considered to be charging.
Hussar.Formations (Ex): As the hussar levels, he learns a number of formations that assist both himself and his allies. Adopting a formation is a move action for the hussar, and allies within range of someone in the formation can enter the formation as a free action. Formations have a limited range, as noted in the formations description. In order for a hussars ally to participate in a formation and gain its benefits, they must start their turn within range of another ally who is participating in the formation. Allies participating in a formation do not necessarily have to be within range of the hussar; they merely must be within range of another ally within the formation. A hussar may only have one formation active at a time, and if the hussar leaves a formation, all allies in the formation also leave that formation. A creature can only gain the benefits of one formation at any given time. The hussar selects one formation from the following list to learn at 5th, 8th, 11th, 14th, and 17th levels:
Hussar.Aura (Ex): An ordained defender who worships a chaotic, evil, good, or lawful deity has a particularly powerful aura (as a cleric) corresponding to the deitys alignment (see thedetect evilspell for details).
Hussar.Divine Gift (Su): At 3rd level, an ordained defender receives supernatural empowerment from her deity in the form of a divine gift. She receives her choice of one inquisitor inquisition or warpriest blessing. She must be of the correct alignment to choose an alignment-based blessing. For determining the abilities gained from an inquisition, the ordained defenders effective inqusitor level is equal to her ordained defender level 2.
Hussar.Guardianship (Ex): At 1st level, the sworn protector may select a ward, a person whom she must protect no matter what the cost. When in combat and the sworn protectors ward is within 10ft of their wards position, the ward gains a +1 morale bonus to their AC and savings throws. This bonus increases by +1 at 5th level, and every four levels after that (9th, 13th, and 17th level). Additionally, the sworn protector may add her guardianship bonus to her attack and damage rolls as a morale bonus if the ward is within the sworn protectors guardianship range. This radius increases by 10ft at 6th and again at 12th level. A sworn protector may only have one ward at a time at 1st level; they may then select a second ward at 8th level and a 3rd ward at 15th level. To select a ward, the sworn protector must take ten minutes discussing tactics and practicing with his ward so that he may learn how best to protect him, and from there on he practices those tactics when he readies his maneuvers. A sworn protector may dismiss a creature as his ward at anytime as a free action.
Hussar.Defensive Intercept (Ex): With swift speed and trained instincts, a sworn protector is capable of sudden bursts of speed in the defense of a chosen ward. A number of times per day equal to 1 + the sworn protectors Intelligence bonus she may leap to her wards defense with lightning speed. As an immediate action, the sworn protector moves up to her base speed to a space within 10 ft. of a ward who is being subjected to an attack or effect that would cause harm, to thereby grant her guardianship benefits. This movement is subject to attacks of opportunity. If the sworn protector is too distant to reach her ward, she cannot use this ability.
Hussar.Shared Counter (Ex): At 3rd level, the warders ability to protect those around him expands to allow him to use readied counters with a range of personal to protect another as long as he is adjacent to their position. If the counter is unsuccessful, then the protected ally must rely on their own defenses. He may use this with no daily limit, but only as often as he has an immediate action to initiate a counter. Additionally, in the defense of a ward she may use her defensive intercept ability as part of the same immediate action to use a shared counter. This ability functions with the Extended Defense class feature.
Hussar.Zweihander Training: At 1st level, when wielding a two-handed weapon or a one-handed weapon in both hands, the warder gains a shield bonus to his armor class equal to his aegis class feature bonus.
Hussar.Zweihander Expertise (Ex): A zweihander sentinel loses access to the Broken Blade discipline and addsScarlet Throneto her list of available disciplines. She gains Sense Motive as a class skill. This ability does not cause zweihander sentinel archetype to be incompatible with other archetypes that alter the maneuvers class feature or her available disciplines, so long as she can still give up Broken Blade.
Hussar.Armament Shield (Ex): When wielding a one-handed weapon in two hands or a two-handed weapon, the weapon is treated as a light shield for the purposes of performing a shield bash attack on an opponent. The warder smashes with the butt of a spear-haft, the pommel of a greatsword, or the broadside of her axe. All are essentially the same and are treated as light shields for the purposes of shield bash attacks or martial maneuvers to be used with a weapon of this type (such as Iron Tortoise maneuvers that require a shield to function).

This damage is not multiplied if the character scores a successful critical hit.

This mount functions as a druids animal companion, using the hussars level as his effective druid level. The creature must be one that he is capable of riding and is suitable as a mount. A Medium-sized hussar can select a camel or a horse. A Small-sized hussar can select a pony or wolf, but can also select a boar or a dog if he is at least 4th level. At the GMs options, other animals may be suitable mounts for a hussar to select.
Ordained_Defender.Mounted Combat (Ex): At 1st level, a hussar gains Mounted Combat as a bonus feat, even if he does not meet the prerequisites.
Ordained_Defender.Mounted Maneuver Expertise (Ex): Starting at 1st level, a hussar and his trusty steed are so in tune with each other that they can work as one when performing maneuvers. Whenever a hussar is mounted and uses a maneuver with a movement component (such as making a charge attack, or taking an extra move action), the hussar can have his mount take the appropriate movement in his place. If the maneuver allows the hussar to make a charge attack, both him and his mount are considered to be charging.
Ordained_Defender.Formations (Ex): As the hussar levels, he learns a number of formations that assist both himself and his allies. Adopting a formation is a move action for the hussar, and allies within range of someone in the formation can enter the formation as a free action. Formations have a limited range, as noted in the formations description. In order for a hussars ally to participate in a formation and gain its benefits, they must start their turn within range of another ally who is participating in the formation. Allies participating in a formation do not necessarily have to be within range of the hussar; they merely must be within range of another ally within the formation. A hussar may only have one formation active at a time, and if the hussar leaves a formation, all allies in the formation also leave that formation. A creature can only gain the benefits of one formation at any given time. The hussar selects one formation from the following list to learn at 5th, 8th, 11th, 14th, and 17th levels:
Ordained_Defender.Aura (Ex): An ordained defender who worships a chaotic, evil, good, or lawful deity has a particularly powerful aura (as a cleric) corresponding to the deitys alignment (see thedetect evilspell for details).
Ordained_Defender.Divine Gift (Su): At 3rd level, an ordained defender receives supernatural empowerment from her deity in the form of a divine gift. She receives her choice of one inquisitor inquisition or warpriest blessing. She must be of the correct alignment to choose an alignment-based blessing. For determining the abilities gained from an inquisition, the ordained defenders effective inqusitor level is equal to her ordained defender level 2.
Ordained_Defender.Guardianship (Ex): At 1st level, the sworn protector may select a ward, a person whom she must protect no matter what the cost. When in combat and the sworn protectors ward is within 10ft of their wards position, the ward gains a +1 morale bonus to their AC and savings throws. This bonus increases by +1 at 5th level, and every four levels after that (9th, 13th, and 17th level). Additionally, the sworn protector may add her guardianship bonus to her attack and damage rolls as a morale bonus if the ward is within the sworn protectors guardianship range. This radius increases by 10ft at 6th and again at 12th level. A sworn protector may only have one ward at a time at 1st level; they may then select a second ward at 8th level and a 3rd ward at 15th level. To select a ward, the sworn protector must take ten minutes discussing tactics and practicing with his ward so that he may learn how best to protect him, and from there on he practices those tactics when he readies his maneuvers. A sworn protector may dismiss a creature as his ward at anytime as a free action.
Ordained_Defender.Defensive Intercept (Ex): With swift speed and trained instincts, a sworn protector is capable of sudden bursts of speed in the defense of a chosen ward. A number of times per day equal to 1 + the sworn protectors Intelligence bonus she may leap to her wards defense with lightning speed. As an immediate action, the sworn protector moves up to her base speed to a space within 10 ft. of a ward who is being subjected to an attack or effect that would cause harm, to thereby grant her guardianship benefits. This movement is subject to attacks of opportunity. If the sworn protector is too distant to reach her ward, she cannot use this ability.
Ordained_Defender.Shared Counter (Ex): At 3rd level, the warders ability to protect those around him expands to allow him to use readied counters with a range of personal to protect another as long as he is adjacent to their position. If the counter is unsuccessful, then the protected ally must rely on their own defenses. He may use this with no daily limit, but only as often as he has an immediate action to initiate a counter. Additionally, in the defense of a ward she may use her defensive intercept ability as part of the same immediate action to use a shared counter. This ability functions with the Extended Defense class feature.
Ordained_Defender.Zweihander Training: At 1st level, when wielding a two-handed weapon or a one-handed weapon in both hands, the warder gains a shield bonus to his armor class equal to his aegis class feature bonus.
Ordained_Defender.Zweihander Expertise (Ex): A zweihander sentinel loses access to the Broken Blade discipline and addsScarlet Throneto her list of available disciplines. She gains Sense Motive as a class skill. This ability does not cause zweihander sentinel archetype to be incompatible with other archetypes that alter the maneuvers class feature or her available disciplines, so long as she can still give up Broken Blade.
Ordained_Defender.Armament Shield (Ex): When wielding a one-handed weapon in two hands or a two-handed weapon, the weapon is treated as a light shield for the purposes of performing a shield bash attack on an opponent. The warder smashes with the butt of a spear-haft, the pommel of a greatsword, or the broadside of her axe. All are essentially the same and are treated as light shields for the purposes of shield bash attacks or martial maneuvers to be used with a weapon of this type (such as Iron Tortoise maneuvers that require a shield to function).
Ordained_Defender.Defensive Reach (Ex): At 6th level, the warder has supreme control over his environment and the use of his weapon to defend himself and his allies. When wielding a non-reach two-handed weapon, the warder increases his reach by five feet for use with attacks of opportunity and counters. When wielding a two-handed reach weapon the warder threatens adjacent enemies and may attack them as though he was not wielding a reach weapon.
Ordained_Defender.Punishing Defenses (Ex): At 12th level, the warder has gained a great deal of skill in using offense as his best defense. When making an attack of opportunity or when making an attack against a foe as part of a counter, he inflicts an additional 2d6 points of damage. This damage is not multiplied if the character scores a successful critical hit.

Sworn_Protector.Converting Your Character: The hussar is a class template suitable for use with the warlord and warder classes. When converting a character to a hussar, the character loses or changes the following class features:
Sworn_Protector.Maneuvers: A good-aligned ordained defender addsSilver Craneto her list of available disciplines, an evil-aligned ordained defender addsBlack Seraphto her list of available disciplines, and an ordained defender who is neither good nor evil addsEternal Guardianto her list of available disciplines. If the ordained defender does not have this disciplines associated skill as a class skill, she gains it as a class skill. Her initiation modifier is Wisdom, and any warder class features that previously used her Intelligence modifier now use her Wisdom modifier. She otherwise learns, readies, and initiates maneuvers as a standard warder.
Sworn_Protector.Iaido (Ex): In addition to his normal maneuver recovery, a bushi can recover his maneuvers by sheathing his blade and taking a brief moment of quiet contemplation. When he sheathes a weapon (normally a move action), he recovers one maneuver. He cannot recover more than one maneuver per round this way, no matter how many weapons he sheathes or how many times he sheathes an individual weapon per round, nor can he use a maneuver in the same round it is recovered in this way. A bushi cannot use this ability to recover a maneuver in the same round in which it was initiated.
Sworn_Protector.Iaido Training (Ex): At 1st level, a bushi gains Exotic Weapon Proficiency (katana) and Exotic Weapon Proficiency (wakizashi) as bonus feats, even if he does not meet their prerequisites.
Sworn_Protector.Quick Draw (Ex): At 1st level, a bushi gains Quick Draw as a bonus feat, even if he does not meet the prerequisites. In addition, the bushi may sheathe his weapon without provoking attacks of opportunity.
Sworn_Protector.Mixed Combat (Ex): At 6th level, a bushi gainsMixed Combatas a bonus feat, even if he does not meet the prerequisites. In addition, the bushi is considered to be threatening all adjacent squares even if his weapon is sheathed, and can draw his weapon when making any attack (including attacks of opportunity).
Sworn_Protector.Bushido (Su): As a bushi grows in power, he gains access to abilities through the refinement of his spirit and his weapon by adhering to the principles of bushido.
Sworn_Protector.Weapon and Armor Proficiencies: The zweihander sentinel loses proficiency with shields and tower shields.
Sworn_Protector.Disciplines: The hawkguard gains access toSolar Wind, losing access to Primal Fury. Survival is no longer a class skill; Perception is now a class skill.
Sworn_Protector.Bonus Feat: The dervish defender gains Two-Weapon Fighting as a bonus feat at 1st level.
Sworn_Protector.Two-Weapon Defense (Ex): While not all dervish defenders fight in the same manner, most do and all are extensively trained in these fighting philosophies. While wearing light armor or no armor, wielding a weapon in each hand (or using a double weapon), and not using a shield heavier than a buckler, the warder may add her Intelligence bonus (if any) to her Armor Class. She retains this bonus even against touch attacks or when flat-footed, but loses this bonus should she be rendered helpless by any means.
Sworn_Protector.Dervish Defense (Ex): A dervish defender is capable of an aggressive defense, attacking even as they defend. At 4th level, the dervish defender may use a counter against an enemys attack and if she successfully counters it, she may make an immediate attack of opportunity against that foe.
Sworn_Protector.Shield of Blades (Ex): At 6th level, when fighting unarmed or with a weapon from the light blades, double weapon or close weapon weapon group in each hand, the dervish defender improves her shield bonus to AC by an amount equal to her aegis bonus. As an immediate action, the dervish defender may lose her shield bonus to armor class until the beginning of her next turn and grant an adjacent creature an equivalent shield bonus to armor class until the beginning of the dervish defenders next turn.
Sworn_Protector.Grace of Blades (Ex): At 15th level the dervish defender gains mastery over her two-weapon style. Whenever the dervish defender makes an attack with one weapon while holding two or more weapons or using a double weapon (such as during a full attack during which she is not two-weapon fighting, or using a strike that includes a melee attack) she increases that attacks damage by an amount equal to one of her off-hand weapons damage (including any extraordinary and magical enhancements) plus one-half her Strength modifier. Whenever the dervish defender makes an attack with more than one weapon (such as when making a full attack while two-weapon fighting or a strike that includes an attack with two or more weapons) she increases the damage of her weapons (and their enhancements) by one die step (as if increasing in size).
Sworn_Protector.Critical Evasion (Ex): This functions as the born of steel class feature, but only functions if the character is wearing light armor or no armor.
Sworn_Protector.Lore of the Planes: The excruciator may trade one of her available disciplines for theElemental Fluxdiscipline. This ability does not cause excruciator archetype to be incompatible with other archetypes that alter the maneuvers class feature or her available disciplines. She otherwise learns, readies, initiates maneuvers as a standard member of her base class. In addition, the excruciator may select akashic feats as bonus feats in addition to combat feats.
Sworn_Protector.Cosmic Agony (Su): At 5th level, the excruciator gains the ability to establish a planar link which intensifies as she takes damage. Whenever the excruciator takes damage equal to or greater than her initiator level, she gains one point of temporary essence which lasts for 1 minute. The excruciator can have a maximum number of temporary essence from this ability equal to half her excruciator level. Once per round, the excruciator may intentionally harm herself to compound this link as a swift action taking damage equal to her initiator level, to enter a stance or use a boost, and gaining 1 point of temporary essence. This essence, in addition to any other essence the excruciator possesses, can be invested in the following ways:
Sworn_Protector.Mantle of Pain (Su): At 11th level, the excruciator learns to share the fruits of their suffering with those around them. Any creatures within the excruciators collective or affected by their aegis share the benefits of any essence invested in the Cosmic Agony class feature.
Sworn_Protector.Master of Pain (Su): At 14th level, the excruciator has become so accustomed to suffering that injuries no longer trouble them. The excruciator becomes immune to pain effects and the bleeding condition. The excruciator gains one point of temporary point of essence when targeted by a pain effect or when they reduce a creature to 0 hit points (this counts as essence gained through cosmic agony for determining the max amount of temporary essence that the excruciator can have).
Sworn_Protector.Fiends Grip (Su): The signature feature of fiendbound marauders is the ability to manifest an oversized, spiny spectral claw, often wrapped in barbed chains. To manifest her fiends grip, a warder must be wearing gauntlets or spiked gauntlets, which act as a focus for the weapon to come into the world. The warder can manifest up to one fiends grip for each gauntleted hand she has. Manifesting a fiends grip is a move action, and dismissing one is a free action.
Sworn_Protector.The Dark Mark (Su): A fiendbound marauders armigers mark is tainted by his eldritch power, causing marked creatures to also become cursed for the duration of the mark. The mark is now a supernatural ability, but otherwise functions as the armigers mark class feature. The fiendbound marauder can use feats and abilities that require or alter the armigers mark class feature as normal.
Sworn_Protector.Canny Pugilist (Ex): A fiendbound marauders monstrous fiends grip is as much a part of her body as it is her mind, allowing her to use it to great advantage. Starting at 4th level, the fiendbound marauder adds her fiendbound marauder initiation modifier as a competence bonus on combat maneuver checks made with her fiends grip.
Sworn_Protector.Improved Fiends Grip (Su): Starting at 5th level, the fiendbound marauders fiends grip can strike incorporeal creatures as if it possessed theghost touchweapon special ability. In addition, the fiends grip can be manifested as a free action, rather than a move action. At 11th level, the fiendbound marauders fiends grips critical multiplier increases to x3.
Sworn_Protector.Fiendish Empowerment (Su): At 8th level, the fiendbound marauders fiends grip infects his armor, causing it to grow cruel spikes and blades when her weapon manifests. While her fiends grip is manifested, the fiendbound marauders armor grows+1 ghost toucharmor spikesthat deal piercing and slashing damage. If the armor already had spikes, they grow crueler, dealing damage as if the fiendbound marauder was one size category larger, dealing piercing and slashing damage, and using the enhancement bonus granted by this ability or their original enhancement bonus, whichever is higher, and gaining the benefits of theghost touchweapon special ability. In addition, the fiendbound marauder gains resistance 10 to two of the following energy types: acid, cold, electricity, or fire. At 14th level, the enhancement bonus of these armor spikes increases to +2, and the fiendbound marauder gains resistance 10 to a third energy type from the above list. At 17th level, the enhancement bonus of these armor spikes increases to +3, and the energy resistances granted by this ability increase to 20.
Sworn_Protector.Archer Training (Ex): With the exhaustive training that hawkguards undergo, the hawkguard becomes a skilled ranged combatant who specializes in the use of a branch of ranged weaponry. She may select one ranged weapon to be her favored. When wielding this weapon, she does not suffer a penalty to hit for wearing a buckler and retains her shield bonus to AC even when using that arm to attack with her chosen weapon. The hawkguard also gains Point Blank Shot as a bonus feat.
Sworn_Protector.Ranged Defensive Focus (Ex): The hawkguard is a deadly opponent as he focuses on protecting his allies and himself while planning his next moves. This functions as the normal warder defensive focus, except for the following changes. When recovering warder maneuvers as a full-round action, the hawkguard threatens an area within 15 feet of herself, except for adjacent squares. This area increases by 5 feet for every five initiator levels the hawkguard possesses. The bowman threatens this space only if hes wielding a ranged weapon, and may make attacks of opportunity with ranged weapons as long as Ranged Defensive Focus is active.
Sworn_Protector.Close Combat Archery (Ex): At 3rd level, the hawkguard no longer provokes attacks of opportunity when firing or reloading his favored weapon while threatened in melee combat. When using his ranged defensive focus ability, he may now attack foes in adjacent spaces to himself.
Sworn_Protector.Defending the Sky (Ex): Upon reaching 5th level, the hawkguard becomes increasingly adept at protecting his allies from harm. Once per day he is capable of extending the use of his counters to react to multiple attacks. Any counter that the hawkguard possesses that has a duration of instant instead has a duration of 1 round. He may then use this counter against any attack targeting an allied creature that it could normally be used to repel. Every three levels beyond this (8th, 11th, 14th, and 17th levels) he may use this ability an additional time per day.
Sworn_Protector.Evasive Reflexes (Ex): At 7th level the hawkguard gains evasion (as the rogue class feature, except it functions in medium and heavy armor in addition to light). As an immediate action, he may lose the benefits of the evasion ability for one round and grant it to an ally for one round.
Sworn_Protector.Class Skills: Instead of the rigorous tactical training that most warders undergo, ordained defenders undergo a process of dogmatic indoctrination that lends them to more introspective pursuits, meditating on the nature of their faith and their role in their deitys plan. An ordained defender gains Knowledge (religion) as a class skill and loses Knowledge (nobility) as a class skill.
